title: Power - pd on 16 ohm for same P as 10 V on 4 ohm

content.question: A <math alttext="4 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> resistor has a potential difference of <math alttext="10 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math> across it. What potential difference must be applied across a <math alttext="16 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> resistor in order to dissipate the same amount of power that is dissipated in the <math alttext="4 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> resistor?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
